sen.j: 桂駅（かつらえき）は、京都市西京区にある、阪急電鉄の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, Katsura Station is a stop that is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Katsura Station, located in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop that is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Katsura Station, located in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop that is operated by the Hankyu Railway.

sen.j: 阪急電鉄
sen.e: Hankyu Railway
Hankyu Railway
Hankyu Railway

sen.j: 阪急京都本線
sen.e: Hankyu Kyoto Line
Hankyu Kyoto Line
Hankyu Kyoto Line

sen.j: 阪急嵐山線 ※始発駅
sen.e: Hankyu Arashiyama Line ※The Hankyu Arashiyama Line starts at Katsura Station.
Hankyu Arashiyama Line ※The Hankyu Arashiyama Line starts at Katsura Station.
Hankyu Arashiyama Line * The Hankyu Arashiyama Line starts at Katsura Station.

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置3面6線の地上駅で、橋上駅を有している。
sen.e: Katsura Station is an aboveground station with three platforms serving six tracks (the form of platform and its arrangement); the station is on the bridge.
Katsura Station is an aboveground facility with three platforms serving six tracks; the station is located on the bridge.
Katsura Station is an aboveground facility with three platforms serving six tracks; the station building is located on the bridge.
sen.cmt: 橋上駅→station building is located on the bridge としました。

sen.j: 京都本線の列車は、当駅で優等列車の待避が可能である。
sen.e: Trains running on the Kyoto Line can pass superior trains at this station.
Trains running on the Kyoto Line can pass superior trains at this station.
Trains running on the Kyoto Line can pass superior trains at this station.

sen.j: 平日朝ラッシュ時の10両編成の河原町行き快速急行は当駅で増結されている2両が切り離される。
sen.e: Rapid Express trains for Kawaramachi Station are comprised of ten cars (including two cars added) during the morning rush on weekdays; the added two cars are separated at this station.
Rapid express trains bound for Kawaramachi Station are comprised of ten cars (including two added cars) during the morning rush on weekdays; the additional cars are separated at this station.
Rapid express trains bound for Kawaramachi Station are comprised of ten cars (including two added cars) during the morning rush on weekdays; the additional cars are separated at this station.

sen.j: ペデストリアンデッキ東側は駅ビルに直結している。
sen.e: The pedestrian deck on the east side is connected to the station building.
The pedestrian deck on the east side is connected to the station building.
The pedestrian deck on the east side is connected to the station building.

sen.j: C号線は唯一桂車庫と直接つながっている。
sen.e: Only Track C is connected directly to the Katsura depot.
Only track C is connected directly to the Katsura depot.
Only Ｔrack C is connected directly to the Katsura train depot.
sen.cmt: train depot としました。大文字修正。

sen.j: 当駅始発の京都本線河原町行きの普通列車が発車するほかは、もっぱら回送列車の引込線として使用される。
sen.e: Track C is used for the first Local train bound for Kawaramachi Station on the Kyoto Line and as a railroad siding for deadhead trains.
Track C is used for the first local train bound for Kawaramachi Station on the Kyoto Line and as a railroad siding for deadhead trains.
Track C is used for the first local train bound for Kawaramachi Station on the Kyoto Line and as a railroad siding for deadhead trains.

sen.j: なお、案内上は1号線同様嵐山線ホームとなっている（かつて運転されていた京都本線からの梅田-嵐山間の直通臨時急行がC号線に発着していた実績がある）。
sen.e: Incidentally, in the announcement, Track C is called the Arashiyama Line platform like Track 1 (because there used to have through special express trains that run between Umeda Station and Arashiyama Station on the Kyoto Line, which arrived at and departed from Track C).

Incidentally, in the announcement track C is called the Arashiyama Line platform, like track 1 (because there used to be through special express trains that would run between Umeda Station and Arashiyama Station on the Kyoto Line, which arrived at and departed from track C).

Incidentally, in the announcement Track C is called the Arashiyama Line platform, like Track 1 (because there used to be through special express trains that would run between Umeda Station and Arashiyama Station on the Kyoto Line, which arrived at and departed from Track C).

sen.j: なお、C号線という呼称は、駅改築の際に隣接する桂車庫の留置線であるC号線にホームを設け、そのままのりばの呼称としたものである。
sen.e: When the station was rebuilt, a platform was constructed for Track C, which was originally a storage track of the Katsura depot located adjacent to the station; since then the platform has been called Platform C.

When the station was rebuilt, a platform was constructed for track C, which was originally a storage track of the Katsura depot located adjacent to the station; since then the platform has been referred to as platform C.

When the station was rebuilt, a platform was constructed for Track C, which was originally a storage track of the Katsura train depot located adjacent to the station; since then the platform has been referred to as Platform C.
sen.cmt: train depot としました。大文字に修正。

sen.j: 桂駅には「MEW阪急桂」と呼ばれる商業施設がある。
sen.e: There is a commercial construction called 'MEW Hankyu Katsura' at Katsura Station.
There is a commercial construction called 'MEW Hankyu Katsura' at Katsura Station.
There is a commercial construction called 'MEW Hankyu Katsura' at Katsura Station.

sen.j: 駅の東側には駅ビルの「イースト」、西側にはペデストリアンデッキに付随する形で店舗を構える「ウエスト」と呼ばれるゾーンに分かれて営業している。
sen.e: The commercial construction is operated with 'East' of the station building located on the east side of the station and 'West' comprising stores adjacent to the pedestrian deck on the west side of the station.

The commercial construction is operated with 'East' of the station building located on the east side of the station and 'West' comprising stores adjacent to the pedestrian deck on the west side of the station.

The commercial construction is operated with 'East' of the station building located on the east side of the station and 'West' comprising stores adjacent to the pedestrian deck on the west side of the station.

sen.j: 「イースト」（東口）
sen.e: East' (East entrance)
East' (the east entrance)
East' (the east exit)

sen.j: （イースト駅ビルに隣接する桂駅事務所ビルの1Fには阪急そばがある）
sen.e: (Hankyu Soba resides on the first floor of the Katsura Station office building adjacent to the East station building.)
(Hankyu Soba resides on the first floor of the Katsura Station office building adjacent to the East station building.)
(Hankyu Soba resides on the first floor of the Katsura Station office building adjacent to the East station building.)

sen.e: 2nd floor: bicycle parking area (pay)
Second floor: Paid bicycle parking area
Second floor: Paid bicycle parking area

sen.j: 3F 駅改札、Vie de France（パン屋）、服屋等、手芸の丸十
sen.e: 3rd floor: station ticket gate, Vie de France (bakery), clothing stores, Maruju (handicrafts)
Third floor: Station ticket gate, Vie de France (bakery), clothing stores, Maruju (handicrafts)
Third floor: Station ticket gate, Vie de France (bakery), clothing stores, Maruju (handicrafts)

sen.e: 4th floor: cando (hundred-yen store), Book 1st (bookstore)
Fourth floor: Cando (hundred-yen store), Book First (bookstore)
Fourth floor: Cando (hundred-yen store), Book First (bookstore)

sen.j: 5F ヘアーサロン、TBCグループ（エステ）、塾
sen.e: 5th floor: beauty salon, TBC GROUP (beauty care salon), private school
Fifth floor: Beauty salon, TBC GROUP (beauty-care salon), private school
Fifth floor: Beauty salon, TBC GROUP (beauty-care salon), private school

sen.j: （以前は5Fに書店と眼鏡店があったが、書店は閉店し、眼鏡店は移転したため、現在5Fはさほど活気はない。）
sen.e: (In the past, there was a bookstore and an optician store on the 5th floor, but the bookstore was closed and the optician store was moved out; now there are not so many people on the 5th floor.)

(In the past, there was a bookstore and an optician's store on the fifth floor, but the bookstore was closed and the optician's store was vacated; today there aren't so many people on the fifth floor.)

(In the past, there was a bookstore and an optician's store on the fifth floor, but the bookstore was closed and the optician's store was vacated; today there aren't so many people on the fifth floor.)

sen.j: 注1） 1～5Fにエレベーター、エスカレーターあり。
sen.e: Note 1) There are elevators and escalators from the 1st floor to the 5th floor.
Note 1) There are elevators and escalators from the first floor to the fifth floor.
Note 1) There are elevators and escalators from the first floor to the fifth floor.

sen.j: ただしエレベーターは2Fにはとまらない。
sen.e: But the elevator does not stop at the 2nd floor.
But the elevator does not stop at the second floor.
But the elevator does not stop at the second floor.

sen.j: 注2） 駐輪場（有料）は車庫容量があまり大きくない。
sen.e: Note 2) Capacity of the bicycle parking area (pay) is not very large.
Note 2) The capacity of the bicycle parking area (pay) isn't very large.
Note 2) The capacity of the bicycle parking area (pay) isn't very large.

sen.j: 駅周辺にも京都市営の駐輪場が数箇所ある。
sen.e: There are several bicycle parking areas around the station that are operated by Kyoto City.
Kyoto City operates several bicycle parking areas around the station.
Kyoto City operates several bicycle parking areas around the station.

sen.j: 「ウエスト」（西口）
sen.e: West' (West entrance)
West' (the west entrance)
West' (the west exit)

sen.j: 3F ロッテリア、千鳥饅頭、珈琲待夢アマンド（喫茶店）、花梨（ラーメン）、阪急ハウジングプラザ桂（不動産）
sen.e: 3rd floor: LOTTERIA, Chidoriya, Coffee Time Amando (café), Karin (ramen), Hankyu Housing Plaza Katsura (real estate)
Third floor: LOTTERIA, Chidoriya, Coffee Time Amando (café), Karin (ramen), Hankyu Housing Plaza Katsura (real estate)
Third floor: LOTTERIA, Chidoriya, Coffee Time Amando (café), Karin (ramen), Hankyu Housing Plaza Katsura (real estate)

sen.j: 他、駅改札コンコース付近にアズナス、花屋、らぽっぽ（菓子）、小物アクセサリー店、宝くじ売り場がある。
sen.e: There are also ASNAS, a floor shop, Rapoppo (confectionery), an accessory shop, and a betting house, near the concourse at the station ticket gate.
There are also ASNAS, a floor shop, Rapoppo (confectionery), an accessory shop and a betting house near the concourse at the station ticket gate.
There are also ASNAS, a flower shop, Rapoppo (confectionery), an accessory shop and a betting house near the concourse at the station ticket gate.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 平成15年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約31,616人（京都府統計書より）。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day was about 31,616 in 2003 (adapted from Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 31,616 in 2003 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 31,616 in fiscal year 2003 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report).
sen.cmt: 統一しました。fiscal → fiscal yearに変更しました。

Katsura Imperial Villa (approximately 600 meters from the station)

Katsura Elementary School, Kyoto City

sen.j: 京都市立川岡小学校
sen.e: Kawaoka Elementary School, Kyoto City
Kawaoka Elementary School, Kyoto City
Kawaoka Elementary School, Kyoto City

sen.j: 駅周辺の道路は狭く、その中を路線バスが運行している。
sen.e: Streets around the station are narrow but route buses travel through the streets.
The streets around the station are narrow, but route buses still travel through the area.
The streets around the station are narrow, but route buses still travel through the area.

sen.j: また、駅南側の川岡踏切などは両側を道路に挟まれており、それによる渋滞も発生している。
sen.e: In addition, the Kawaoka (railway) crossing on the south of the station is situated between the streets, resulting in traffic congestion.
Additionally, the Kawaoka (railway) crossing south of the station is situated between the streets, resulting in traffic congestion.
Additionally, the Kawaoka (railway) crossing south of the station is situated between the streets, resulting in traffic congestion.

sen.j: 更に営業列車のみならず、車両基地への入出庫列車によって踏切の遮断機が頻繁に降りる為、周辺住民からは高架化の要望も出ているが、それには巨額の費用がかかり、京都市の財政事情も芳しくない為、実現の目処は立っていない。
sen.e: Furthermore, since the crossing gate comes down every time not only commercial trains but also trains going in and out the rail yard pass the crossing, neighborhood residents have been requesting the elevation of the station; however, because of the huge cost and the poor financial status of Kyoto City, it is uncertain whether the elevation will be realized.

Moreover, because the crossing gate comes down every time, not only commercial trains but also trains entering and leaving the rail yard pass the crossing, neighborhood residents have been requesting the elevation of the station; however, given the huge cost and the poor financial status of Kyoto City it is uncertain whether the elevation will be realized.

Moreover, because the crossing gate comes down every time, not only commercial trains but also trains entering and leaving the rail yard pass the crossing, neighborhood residents have been requesting the elevation of the station; however, given the huge cost and the poor financial status of Kyoto City it is uncertain whether the elevation will be realized.

sen.j: それらの問題の緩和を狙って洛西口駅が開業（かつての物集女駅とほぼ同位置）する運びになった。
sen.e: Under the circumstances and to improve the situation, Rakusaiguchi Station was opened (at substantially the same location as the old Mozume Station).
Under the circumstances, and to improve the situation, Rakusaiguchi Station was opened (at basically the same location as the old Mozume Station).
Under the circumstances, and to improve the situation, Rakusaiguchi Station was opened (at basically the same location as the old Mozume Station).

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月1日 新京阪鉄道高槻町～西院間開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: On November 1, 1928 the station was opened when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.
November 1, 1928: The station was opened concurrently with the opening of the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway.
November 1, 1928: The station was opened concurrently with the opening of the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月9日 嵐山線が開通、乗換駅となる。
sen.e: On November 9, 1928 the Arashiyama Line was opened and the station became a stop for transfer.
November 9, 1928: The Arashiyama Line was opened and the station became a stop for transfers.
November 9, 1928: The Arashiyama Line was opened and the station became a stop for transfers.

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）9月15日 会社合併により、京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On September 15, 1930 Katsura Station became a stop operated by the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Katsura Station became a stop operated by the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Katsura Station became a stop operated by the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 京阪電気鉄道と阪神急行電鉄との合併により、京阪神急行電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On October 1, 1943 Katsura Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway as a result of amalgamation of the Keihan Electric Railway and the Hanshin Electric Express Railway.
October 1, 1943: Katsura Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway as a result of amalgamation of the Keihan Electric Railway and the Hanshin Electric Express Railway.
October 1, 1943: Katsura Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway as a result of amalgamation of the Keihan Electric Railway and the Hanshin Electric Express Railway.

sen.j: 1973年（昭和48年）4月1日 社名変更により、阪急電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1973 Katsura Station came to be a stop of the Hankyu Railway as a result of the change of the company name.
April 1, 1973: Katsura Station came to be a stop of the Hankyu Railway due to the change of the company's name.
April 1, 1973: Katsura Station came to be a stop of the Hankyu Railway due to the change of the company's name.

sen.j: 2007年（平成17年）3月17日 通勤特急停車駅となり、全列車停車駅に昇格。
sen.e: On March 17, 2007 (Commuter) Limited Express trains came to stop at Katsura Station, thus making all the trains stopping at Katsura Station.
March 17, 2007: The commuter limited express trains came to stop at Katsura Station, thus making all the trains stop at Katsura Station.
March 17, 2007: The commuter limited express trains came to stop at Katsura Station, thus making all the trains stop at Katsura Station.

sen.j: ローソンのカツ弁当のCMのロケ地として当駅構内が使用された。
sen.e: The station was used on location for the commercial of the LAWSON's pork cutlet box lunch (Katsu-bento).
The station was used as a location for the shooting of a commercial for the LAWSON's pork cutlet box lunch (Katsu-bento).
The station was used as a location for the shooting of a commercial for the LAWSON's pork cutlet box lunch (Katsu-bento).

sen.j: そのCMの出演者は桂三枝と華原朋美。
sen.e: The cast of the commercial were Sanshi KATSURA and Tomomi KAHARA.
Sanshi KATSURA and Tomomi KAHARA were cast in the commercial.
Sanshi KATSURA and Tomomi KAHARA were cast in the commercial.

sen.j: 「カツだ!」と「桂」を掛けた内容であった。
sen.e: In the commercial, 'cutlet (katsu) and 'KATSURA' were made a pun.
In the commercial, a pun was made of 'cutlet' (katsu) and 'KATSURA.'
In the commercial, a pun was made of 'cutlet' (katsu) and 'KATSURA.'

sen.j: 河原町行きホーム（2・3号線）の種別・行き先案内機は反転フラップ式案内表示機であるが、他駅とは違い「特急 河原町ゆき」のように、行き先駅名称の後ろに「ゆき」が添えられている。
sen.e: The type/destination information board installed on the platform for Kawaramachi (Platforms 2 and 3) is a rotatable-flap display, which differs from that of other stations in that a flap displaying 'for' is added to the name of the destination, like 'Limited Express for Kawaramachi.'

The type/destination information board installed on the platform for Kawaramachi (platforms 2 and 3) is a rotatable-flap display, which differs from that of other stations in that a flap displaying 'for' is added to the name of the destination, such as 'Limited Express for Kawaramachi.'

The type/destination information board installed on the platform for Kawaramachi (platforms 2 and 3) is a rotatable-flap display, which differs from that of other stations in that a flap displaying 'for' is added to the name of the destination, such as 'Limited Express for Kawaramachi.'

sen.j: この表示は先発表示と一体型で、一昔前の阪急の反転式案内でよく見られたものである（表示の中には、今はなき「快速」の種別の案内も残っている。
sen.e: This display is an integration type that displays the first departure, which type used to be found often in the old rotatable-flap displays of the Hankyu Railway (In the display, the flap 'Rapid' (not in service) still remains.

This display is an integration type that displays the first departure, which used to be found often in the old rotatable-flap displays of the Hankyu Railway (however, in the display, the flap 'Rapid' (not in service) remains).

This display is an integration type that displays the first departure, which used to be found often in the old rotatable-flap displays of the Hankyu Railway (however, in the display, the flap 'Rapid' (not in service) remains).

sen.j: 反転式の案内機が現存する阪急の駅の中でも、このようなものが現在も使用されているのは当駅のみである）。
sen.e: This type of rotatable-flap display is still used only at Katsura Station among the stations of the Hankyu Railway that still use rotatable-flap displays.)
This type of rotatable-flap display is still used only at Katsura Station among the stations of the Hankyu Railway that still use rotatable-flap displays.)
This type of rotatable-flap display is still used only at Katsura Station among the stations of the Hankyu Railway that still use rotatable-flap displays.)

sen.j: 一方、大阪方面行ホーム（4・5号線）は発光ダイオード、嵐山線ホーム（C・1号線）は行灯式の種別・行き先案内機が設置されているが、これらは行き先駅名称に「ゆき」はつかない。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the LED display board and the lamp-stand type display board are installed as type/destination information boards on the platform for Osaka (Platforms 4 and 5) and the Arashiyama Line platform (Platforms C and 1), respectively, which boards do not display 'for' with the destinations.

Meanwhile, the LED display board and the lamp-stand type of display board are installed as type/destination information boards on the platform for Osaka (platforms 4 and 5) and the Arashiyama Line platform (platforms C and 1), respectively, but those boards don't display 'for' as part of the destinations.

Meanwhile, the LED display board and the lamp-stand type of display board are installed as type/destination information boards on the platform for Osaka (platforms 4 and 5) and the Arashiyama Line platform (platforms C and 1), respectively, but those boards don't display 'for' as part of the destinations.

sen.j: 漫才師ブラックマヨネーズのネタに、「禿げているのに、名前は小杉（髪が濃すぎ）。
sen.e: The manzai comedian duo called Black Mayonnaise has a story relating to Katsura: 'Despite my bald-head, my name is Kosugi (i.e., thick hair).
The manzai comedian duo "Black Mayonnaise" has a story related to Katsura: 'Despite my bald head, my name is Kosugi (i.e., thick hair).
The manzai comedian duo "Black Mayonnaise" has a story related to Katsura: 'Despite my bald head, my name is Kosugi (i.e., thick hair).

sen.j: 桂出身です。
sen.e: I'm from Katsura (i.e., wig).
I'm from Katsura (i.e., wig).
I'm from Katsura (i.e., wig).

sen.j: ほんとに京都に桂というところがあるんですよ。」というものがある。
sen.e: In fact, there is a place called Katsura, in Kyoto.'
In fact, there is a place called Katsura, in Kyoto.'
In fact, there is a place called Katsura, in Kyoto.'
